decision_conditions: Please complete the householder application form which can be downloaded from our website http://www.planningportal.gov.uk/planning/applications/howtoapply/permissiontypes

The Proposed First Floor Plan (Drawing Ref.: 2019-32TL-EXT-4) does not show the entire roof of the full width roof of the porch extension on the ground floor, compared to the Proposed Front elevation (Drawing Ref.: 2019-32TL-EXT-5)Please amend accordingly and resubmit
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced within 3 years from the date of this decision.Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act, 1990.  (As amended)

The facing materials to be used in the construction of the building shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

For clarity this permission does not relate to the illuminated shopfront fascia sign, projecting/hanging sign and awning detailed in planning application 19/02726/ADV.Reason:  For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

You have provided Existing floor plans which meet all requirments however the other set of floorplans accompanying this application is not labelled (No Title or Drawing Number) and does not contain a scale bar. Please provide the following:
Condition 18 - Tree and Landscape Officer has reviewed information submitted and is satisfied this can now be discharged.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation. These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts. A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works to the Pine are acceptable to maintain the tree while reducing the impact on the adjacent house and its roof. The Birch is notcovered by the TPO and is not contributing to public amenity so could not be considered for a TPO either.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Acceptabel works to reduce and maintain 2 very large trees growing immediate to the building and impacting upon the roof and windows.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to manage and maintain the trees in a communal garden serving a block of flats.Recommendation:Approve.
